pages.text: Polybranchiaspis was a genus of agnathan (jawless fish) that lived during the Late Silurian to Early Devonian (427 - 411 million years ago). Its remains have been found in China, specifically at the Kuanti Formation and at the Cuifengshan Assemblage in Qujing.
